text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Ravi a senior technical
account manager here at the AWS office
in Dallas
today I'm going to show you how to make
a hostname persist when you reboot or
stop and start your parmesan elastic
compute Cloud instance let's get started
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the ec2 console
then select the instance that you want
to update the hostname for
choose connect to SSH into the instance
run the hostname CTL command from the
shell to update the hostname of your
rhem7 or Centos 7 Linux instance
in the command replace persistent hyphen
hostname with the name that you want the
instance to use
use the VA Text Editor to update the
slash PTC slash cloud slash cloud.cfg
file on your rhem7 or Centos 7 in the
next instance
and add the string preserve underscore
hostname colon true to the bottom of the
file
save and exit the vi editor
run the reboot command to reboot the PC2
instance
after reboot run the Linux hostname
command without any parameters to verify
that the host name change persisted
so now you know how to make a hostname
persist when you reboot or stop and
start your Amazon ec2 instance
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
foreign
[Music]
